message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This report analyzes data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys of 2016 and 2019 in India to examine gender differences in access to finance for small and medium-sized enterprises.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Gender", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "The report draws on datasets from the International Energy Agency and the World Health Organization to explore the linkages between energy access and health outcomes in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency", "World Health Organization"], "topic": ["Energy", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "We used household-level panel data from the India Human Development Survey-II (IHDS-II) to investigate the effect of MGNREGA on poverty reduction and employment creation in rural areas.", "dataset": ["India Human Development Survey-II (IHDS-II)"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Demographic and Health Surveys, we examine the extent to which inequality in child stunting prevalence can be explained using the standard set of socio-economic determinants.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "We draw on data from the World Bank's Logistics Performance Index, International Transport Forum, and United Nations Conference on Trade and Development to assess the impact of corruption on transport costs and trade competitiveness in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Logistics Performance Index", "International Transport Forum", "United Nations Conference on Trade and Development"], "topic": ["Trade", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "To measure the exposure to natural disasters faced by urban households in Vietnam, we combine household-level survey data from Vietnam Household Living Standards Survey with natural disaster data from the Vietnam Disaster Management Authority and Earthquake Data Center.", "dataset": ["Vietnam Household Living Standards Survey", "Vietnam Disaster Management Authority", "Earthquake Data Center"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis is based on datasets from the World Health Organization, the Global Burden of Disease Study 2015, and the China Family Panel Studies.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization", "Global Burden of Disease Study 2015", "China Family Panel Studies"], "topic": ["Health", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Financial Access Survey, we examine the link between financial inclusion and household welfare in seven Southeast Asian countries.", "dataset": ["Financial Access Survey"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We utilize dataset from the World Bank's Doing Business report to investigate the relationship between taxation, firm entry, and firm growth in African countries.", "dataset": ["Doing Business report"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Using a unique dataset of over 100,000 firms in 21 African countries compiled by the World Bank Group, we analyze the impact of business environment constraints on firm productivity and growth.", "dataset": ["World Bank Group"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Jobs & Development"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "This report analyzes data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys of 2016 and 2019 in India to examine gender differences in access to finance for small and medium-sized enterprises.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Gender", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "The report draws on datasets from the International Energy Agency and the World Health Organization to explore the linkages between energy access and health outcomes in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency", "World Health Organization"], "topic": creation in rural areas.", "dataset": ["India Human Development Survey-II (IHDS-II)"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Demographic and Health Surveys, we examine the extent to which inequality in child stunting prevalence can be explained using the standard set of socio-economic determinants.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": Trade and Development to assess the impact of corruption on transport costs and trade competitiveness in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Logistics Performance Index", "International Transport Forum", "United Nations Conference on Trade and Development"], "topic": ["Trade", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "To measure the exposure to natural disasters faced by urban households in Vietnam, we combine household-level survey data from Vietnam Household Living Standards Survey with natural disaster data from the Vietnam Disaster Management Authority and Earthquake Data Center.", "dataset": ["Vietnam Household Living Standards Survey", "Vietnam Disaster Management Authority", "Earthquake Data Center"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis is based on datasets from the World Health Organization, the Global Burden of Disease Study 2015, and the China Family Panel Studies.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization", "Global Burden of Disease Study 2015", "China Family Panel Studies"], "topic": ["Health", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Financial Access Survey, we examine the link between financial inclusion and household welfare in seven Southeast Asian countries.", "dataset": ["Financial Access Survey"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We utilize dataset from the World Bank's Doing Business report to investigate the relationship between taxation, firm entry, and firm growth in African countries.", "dataset": ["Doing Business report"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Using a unique dataset of over 100,000 firms in 21 African countries compiled by the World Bank Group, we analyze the impact of business environment constraints on firm productivity and growth.", "dataset": ["World Bank Group"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Jobs & Development"]}]
